member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilderUtil.ConvertToPoolBlockingPeriod(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
This method attempts to convert the given value to a PoolBlockingPeriod enum. The algorithm is: * if the value is from type string, it will be matched against PoolBlockingPeriod enum names only, using ordinal, case-insensitive comparer * if the value is from type PoolBlockingPeriod, it will be used as is * if the value is from integral type (SByte, Int16, Int32, Int64, Byte, UInt16, UInt32, or UInt64), it will be converted to enum * if the value is another enum or any other type, it will be blocked with an appropriate ArgumentException
in any case above, if the conerted value is out of valid range, the method raises ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
member.returns: PoolBlockingPeriod value in the valid range

in any case above, if the converted value is out of valid range, the method raises ArgumentOutOfRangeException.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlColumnEncryptionEnclaveProvider
member.summary: The base class that defines the interface for enclave providers for Always Encrypted. An enclave is a protected region of memory inside SQL Server, used for computations on encrypted columns. An enclave provider encapsulates the client-side implementation details of the enclave attestation protocol as well as the logic for creating and caching enclave sessions.

The base class that defines the interface for enclave providers for Always Encrypted. An enclave is a protected region of memory inside SQL Server, used for computations on encrypted columns. An enclave provider encapsulates the client-side implementation details of the enclave attestation protocol as well as the logic for creating and caching enclave sessions.

members.member: Performs enclave attestation, generates a symmetric key for the session, creates a an enclave session and stores the session information in the cache. The information the provider uses to attest the enclave and generate a symmetric key for the session. The format of this information is specific to the enclave attestation protocol. A Diffie-Hellman algorithm object encapsulating a client-side key pair. The endpoint of an attestation service for attesting the enclave. The name of the SQL Server instance containing the enclave. The requested enclave session or null if the provider does not implement session caching. A counter that the enclave provider is expected to increment each time SqlClient retrieves the session from the cache. The purpose of this field is to prevent replay attacks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlColumnEncryptionEnclaveProvider.GetEnclaveSession(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlEnclaveSession@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Looks up an existing enclave session information in the enclave session cache. If the enclave provider does not implement enclave session caching, this method is expected to return null.
member.param: The name of the SQL Server instance containing the enclave.
The endpoint of an attestation service, SqlClient contacts to attest the enclave.
The requested enclave session or null if the provider does not implement session caching.
A counter that the enclave provider is expected to increment each time SqlClient retrieves the session from the cache. The purpose of this field is to prevent replay attacks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand.IsColumnEncryptionEnabled

devdoc.para: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlInternalConnectionTds.CheckEnlistedTransactionBinding
member.summary: Validate the enlisted transaction state, taking into consideration the ambient transaction and transaction unbinding mode. If there is no enlisted transaction, this method is a nop.

remarks.para: This method must be called while holding a lock on the SqlInternalConnection instance, to ensure we don't accidentally execute after the transaction has completed on a different thread, causing us to unwittingly execute in auto-commit mode.
When using Explicit transaction unbinding, verify that the enlisted transaction is active and equal to the current ambient transaction.

When using Implicit transaction unbinding, verify that the enlisted transaction is active. If it is not active, and the transaction object has been disposed, unbind from the transaction. If it is not active and not disposed, throw an exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAeadAes256CbcHmac256Algorithm.EncryptData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encryption Algorithm cell_iv = HMAC_SHA-2-256(iv_key, cell_data) truncated to 128 bits cell_ciphertext = AES-CBC-256(enc_key, cell_iv, cell_data) with PKCS7 padding. cell_tag = HMAC_SHA-2-256(mac_key, versionbyte + cell_iv + cell_ciphertext + versionbyte_length) cell_blob = versionbyte + cell_tag + cell_iv + cell_ciphertext
member.returns: Returns the ciphertext corresponding to the plaintext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAeadAes256CbcHmac256Algorithm.EncryptData(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encryption Algorithm cell_iv = HMAC_SHA-2-256(iv_key, cell_data) truncated to 128 bits cell_ciphertext = AES-CBC-256(enc_key, cell_iv, cell_data) with PKCS7 padding. (optional) cell_tag = HMAC_SHA-2-256(mac_key, versionbyte + cell_iv + cell_ciphertext + versionbyte_length) cell_blob = versionbyte + [cell_tag] + cell_iv + cell_ciphertext
member.param: Does the algorithm require authentication tag.
member.returns: Returns the ciphertext corresponding to the plaintext.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAeadAes256CbcHmac256EncryptionKey
member.summary: Encryption key class containing 4 keys. This class is used by SqlAeadAes256CbcHmac256Algorithm and SqlAes256CbcAlgorithm 1) root key - Main key that is used to derive the keys used in the encryption algorithm 2) encryption key - A derived key that is used to encrypt the plain text and generate cipher text 3) mac_key - A derived key that is used to compute HMAC of the cipher text 4) iv_key - A derived key that is used to generate a synthetic IV from plain text data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlColumnEncryptionKeyStoreProvider
member.summary: Abstract base class for all column encryption Key Store providers. It exposes two functions 1. DecryptColumnEncryptionKey - This is the function used by SqlClient under the covers to decrypt encrypted column encryption key blob. 2. EncryptColumnEncryptionKey - This will be used by client tools that generate DDL for customers 3. SignColumnMasterKeyMetadata - This will be used by client tools that generate Column Master Keys (CMK) for customers 4. VerifyColumnMasterKeyMetadata - This will be used by SqlClient under the covers to verify the CMKs received from SQL Server

member.param: Complete path of an asymmetric key. Path format is specific to a key store provider.

member.param: Complete path of an asymmetric key. Path format is specific to a key store provider.
Plain text column encryption key to be encrypted

member.summary: This function must be implemented by the corresponding Key Store providers that wish to use enclaves with Always Encrypted. This function has a default implementation in the base class that throws NotImplementedException to ensure that it does not break applications that rely on an old API Digitally sign the specified column master key metadata: the key path and the property indicating whether column master key supports enclave computations.
member.param: Complete path of an asymmetric key. Path format is specific to a key store provider.
Boolean indicating whether this key can be sent to trusted enclave

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlColumnEncryptionKeyStoreProvider.VerifyColumnMasterKeyMetadata(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Byte[])
member.summary: This function must be implemented by the corresponding Key Store providers that wish to use enclaves with Always Encrypted. This function has a default implementation in the base class that throws NotImplementedException to ensure that it does not break applications that rely on an old API Verifies whether the specified signature is valid for the column master key with the specified metadata properties: the key path and the property indicating whether column master key supports enclave computations.
member.param: Complete path of an asymmetric key. Path format is specific to a key store provider.
Boolean indicating whether this key can be sent to trusted enclave
Signature for the master key metadata
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the master key metadata can be verified based on the provided signature

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlColumnEncryptionCngProvider
member.summary:
Provides implementation similar to certificate store provider. A CEK encrypted with certificate provider should be decryptable by this provider and vice versa.
Envolope Format for the encrypted column encryption key version + keyPathLength + ciphertextLength + keyPath + ciphertext + signature version: A single byte indicating the format version. keyPathLength: Length of the keyPath. ciphertextLength: ciphertext length keyPath: keyPath used to encrypt the column encryption key. This is only used for troubleshooting purposes and is not verified during decryption. ciphertext: Encrypted column encryption key signature: Signature of the entire byte array. Signature is validated before decrypting the column encryption key.

member.name: T:System.IO.PathInternal
member.summary: Contains internal path helpers that are shared between many projects.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsValidDriveChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if the given character is a valid drive letter

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.EnsureExtendedPrefixIfNeeded(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the extended path prefix (\\?\) if not already a device path, IF the path is not relative, AND the path is more than 259 characters. (> MAX_PATH + null). This will also insert the extended prefix if the path ends with a period or a space. Trailing periods and spaces are normally eaten away from paths during normalization, but if we see such a path at this point it should be normalized and has retained the final characters. (Typically from one of the *Info classes)

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.EnsureExtendedPrefixOverMaxPath(System.String)
member.summary: DO NOT USE- Use EnsureExtendedPrefixIfNeeded. This will be removed shortly. Adds the extended path prefix (\\?\) if not already a device path, IF the path is not relative, AND the path is more than 259 characters. (> MAX_PATH + null)

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.EnsureExtendedPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the extended path prefix (\\?\) if not relative or already a device path.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsDevice(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if the path uses any of the DOS device path syntaxes. ("\\.\", "\\?\", or "\??\")

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsDeviceUNC(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if the path is a device UNC (\\?\UNC\, \\.\UNC\)

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsExtended(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if the path uses the canonical form of extended syntax ("\\?\" or "\??\"). If the path matches exactly (cannot use alternate directory separators) Windows will skip normalization and path length checks.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.HasWildCardCharacters(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Check for known wildcard characters. '*' and '?' are the most common ones.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.GetRootLength(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Gets the length of the root of the path (drive, share, etc.).

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsPartiallyQualified(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if the path specified is relative to the current drive or working directory. Returns false if the path is fixed to a specific drive or UNC path. This method does no validation of the path (URIs will be returned as relative as a result).
member.remarks: Handles paths that use the alternate directory separator. It is a frequent mistake to assume that rooted paths (Path.IsPathRooted) are not relative. This isn't the case. "C:a" is drive relative- meaning that it will be resolved against the current directory for C: (rooted, but relative). "C:\a" is rooted and not relative (the current directory will not be used to modify the path).

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsDirectorySeparator(System.Char)
member.summary: True if the given character is a directory separator.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.NormalizeDirectorySeparators(System.String)
member.summary:
Normalize separators in the given path. Converts forward slashes into back slashes and compresses slash runs, keeping initial 2 if present. Also trims initial whitespace in front of "rooted" paths (see PathStartSkip).
This effectively replicates the behavior of the legacy NormalizePath when it was called with fullCheck=false and expandShortpaths=false. The current NormalizePath gets directory separator normalization from Win32's GetFullPathName(), which will resolve relative paths and as such can't be used here (and is overkill for our uses).
Like the current NormalizePath this will not try and analyze periods/spaces within directory segments.
member.remarks:
The only callers that used to use Path.Normalize(fullCheck=false) were Path.GetDirectoryName() and Path.GetPathRoot(). Both usages do not need trimming of trailing whitespace here.
GetPathRoot() could technically skip normalizing separators after the second segment- consider as a future optimization.
For legacy desktop behavior with ExpandShortPaths: - It has no impact on GetPathRoot() so doesn't need consideration. - It could impact GetDirectoryName(), but only if the path isn't relative (C:\ or \\Server\Share).
In the case of GetDirectoryName() the ExpandShortPaths behavior was undocumented and provided inconsistent results if the path was fixed/relative. For example: "C:\PROGRA~1\A.TXT" would return "C:\Program Files" while ".\PROGRA~1\A.TXT" would return ".\PROGRA~1". If you ultimately call GetFullPath() this doesn't matter, but if you don't or have any intermediate string handling could easily be tripped up by this undocumented behavior.
We won't match this old behavior because:
1. It was undocumented 2. It was costly (extremely so if it actually contained '~') 3. Doesn't play nice with string logic 4. Isn't a cross-plat friendly concept/behavior

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternal.IsEffectivelyEmpty(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if the path is effectively empty for the current OS. For unix, this is empty or null. For Windows, this is empty, null, or just spaces ((char)32).

member.name: T:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlCodeAccess
member.summary: RequiredAccess. Indicates the type of access that a caller must request when opening the file object that represents the device (see IRP_MJ_CREATE).

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlCodeAccess.FILE_ANY_ACCESS
member.summary: The I/O manager sends the IRP for any caller that has a handle to the file object that represents the target device object.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlCodeAccess.FILE_READ_DATA
member.summary: The I/O manager sends the IRP only for a caller with read access rights, allowing the underlying device driver to transfer data from the device to system memory.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlCodeAccess.FILE_WRITE_DATA
member.summary: The I/O manager sends the IRP only for a caller with write access rights, allowing the underlying device driver to transfer data from system memory to its device.

member.name: M:Interop.Kernel32.CTL_CODE(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: CTL_CODE method.
member.param: Identifies the device type. This value must match the value that is set in the DeviceType member of the driver's DEVICE_OBJECT structure.
Identifies the function to be performed by the driver. Values of less than 0x800 are reserved for Microsoft. Values of 0x800 and higher can be used by vendors.
Indicates how the system will pass data between the caller of DeviceIoControl (or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest) and the driver that handles the IRP.
Indicates the type of access that a caller must request when opening the file object that represents the device (see IRP_MJ_CREATE).

member.name: T:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlTransferType
member.summary: TransferType. Indicates how the system will pass data between the caller of DeviceIoControl (or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest) and the driver that handles the IRP.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlTransferType.METHOD_BUFFERED
member.summary: Specifies the buffered I/O method, which is typically used for transferring small amounts of data per request. Most I/O control codes for device and intermediate drivers use this TransferType value.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlTransferType.METHOD_IN_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies the direct I/O method, which is typically used for reading or writing large amounts of data, using DMA or PIO, that must be transferred quickly. Specify METHOD_IN_DIRECT if the caller of DeviceIoControl or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest will pass data to the driver.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlTransferType.METHOD_OUT_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies the direct I/O method, which is typically used for reading or writing large amounts of data, using DMA or PIO, that must be transferred quickly. Specify METHOD_OUT_DIRECT if the caller of DeviceIoControl or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest will receive data from the driver.

member.name: F:Interop.Kernel32.IoControlTransferType.METHOD_NEITHER
member.summary: Specifies neither buffered nor direct I/O. The I/O manager does not provide any system buffers or MDLs. The IRP supplies the user-mode virtual addresses of the input and output buffers that were specified to DeviceIoControl or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest, without validating or mapping them.

member.name: F:Interop.UNICODE_STRING.Length
member.summary: Length, in bytes, not including the the null, if any.

member.name: F:Interop.UNICODE_STRING.MaximumLength
member.summary: Max size of the buffer in bytes

member.name: T:Interop.NtDll.FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION
member.summary: FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION structure. Provides extended attribute (EA) information. This structure is used primarily by network drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION.NextEntryOffset
member.summary: The offset of the next FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION-type entry. This member is zero if no other entries follow this one.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION.Flags
member.summary: Can be zero or can be set with FILE_NEED_EA, indicating that the file to which the EA belongs cannot be interpreted without understanding the associated extended attributes.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION.EaNameLength
member.summary: The length in bytes of the EaName array. This value does not include a null-terminator to EaName.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.FILE_FULL_EA_INFORMATION.EaValueLength
member.summary: The length in bytes of each EA value in the array.

member.name: T:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES structure. The OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES structure specifies attributes that can be applied to objects or object handles by routines that create objects and/or return handles to objects.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.RootDirectory
member.summary: Optional handle to root object directory for the given ObjectName. Can be a file system directory or object manager directory.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.ObjectName
member.summary: Name of the object. Must be fully qualified if RootDirectory isn't set. Otherwise is relative to RootDirectory.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.SecurityDescriptor
member.summary: If null, object will receive default security settings.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.SecurityQualityOfService
member.summary: Optional quality of service to be applied to the object. Used to indicate security impersonation level and context tracking mode (dynamic or static).

member.name: M:Interop.NtDll.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.#ctor(Interop.UNICODE_STRING*,Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Equivalent of InitializeObjectAttributes macro with the exception that you can directly set SQOS.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_INHERIT
member.summary: This handle can be inherited by child processes of the current process.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_PERMANENT
member.summary: This flag only applies to objects that are named within the object manager. By default, such objects are deleted when all open handles to them are closed. If this flag is specified, the object is not deleted when all open handles are closed.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: Only a single handle can be open for this object.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_CASE_INSENSITIVE
member.summary: Lookups for this object should be case insensitive.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_OPENIF
member.summary: Create on existing object should open, not fail with STATUS_OBJECT_NAME_COLLISION.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_OPENLINK
member.summary: Open the symbolic link, not its target.

member.name: T:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition
member.summary: File creation disposition when calling directly to NT APIs.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_SUPERSEDE
member.summary: Default. Replace or create. Deletes existing file instead of overwriting.
member.remarks: As this potentially deletes it requires that DesiredAccess must include Delete. This has no equivalent in CreateFile.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_OPEN
member.summary: Open if exists or fail if doesn't exist. Equivalent to OPEN_EXISTING or .
member.remarks: TruncateExisting also uses Open and then manually truncates the file by calling NtSetInformationFile with FileAllocationInformation and an allocation size of 0.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_CREATE
member.summary: Create if doesn't exist or fail if does exist. Equivalent to CREATE_NEW or .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_OPEN_IF
member.summary: Open if exists or create if doesn't exist. Equivalent to OPEN_ALWAYS or .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_OVERWRITE
member.summary: Open and overwrite if exists or fail if doesn't exist. Equivalent to TRUNCATE_EXISTING or .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateDisposition.FILE_OVERWRITE_IF
member.summary: Open and overwrite if exists or create if doesn't exist. Equivalent to CREATE_ALWAYS or .

member.name: T:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions
member.summary: Options for creating/opening files with NtCreateFile.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_DIRECTORY_FILE
member.summary: File being created or opened must be a directory file. Disposition must be FILE_CREATE, FILE_OPEN, or FILE_OPEN_IF.
member.remarks: Can only be used with FILE_SYNCHRONOUS_IO_ALERT/NONALERT, FILE_WRITE_THROUGH, FILE_OPEN_FOR_BACKUP_INTENT, and FILE_OPEN_BY_FILE_ID flags.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_WRITE_THROUGH
member.summary: Applications that write data to the file must actually transfer the data into the file before any requested write operation is considered complete. This flag is set automatically if FILE_NO_INTERMEDIATE_BUFFERING is set.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_SEQUENTIAL_ONLY
member.summary: All accesses to the file are sequential.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_INTERMEDIATE_BUFFERING
member.summary: File cannot be cached in driver buffers. Cannot use with AppendData desired access.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_SYNCHRONOUS_IO_ALERT
member.summary: All operations are performed synchronously. Any wait on behalf of the caller is subject to premature termination from alerts.
member.remarks: Cannot be used with FILE_SYNCHRONOUS_IO_NONALERT. Synchronous DesiredAccess flag is required. I/O system will maintain file position context.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_SYNCHRONOUS_IO_NONALERT
member.summary: All operations are performed synchronously. Waits in the system to synchronize I/O queuing and completion are not subject to alerts.
member.remarks: Cannot be used with FILE_SYNCHRONOUS_IO_ALERT. Synchronous DesiredAccess flag is required. I/O system will maintain file position context.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_NON_DIRECTORY_FILE
member.summary: File being created or opened must not be a directory file. Can be a data file, device, or volume.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_CREATE_TREE_CONNECTION
member.summary: Create a tree connection for this file in order to open it over the network.
member.remarks: Not used by device and intermediate drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_COMPLETE_IF_OPLOCKED
member.summary: Complete the operation immediately with a success code of STATUS_OPLOCK_BREAK_IN_PROGRESS if the target file is oplocked.
member.remarks: Not compatible with ReserveOpfilter or OpenRequiringOplock. Not used by device and intermediate drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_EA_KNOWLEDGE
member.summary: If the extended attributes on an existing file being opened indicate that the caller must understand extended attributes to properly interpret the file, fail the request.
member.remarks: Not used by device and intermediate drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_RANDOM_ACCESS
member.summary: Accesses to the file can be random, so no sequential read-ahead operations should be performed on the file by FSDs or the system.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_DELETE_ON_CLOSE
member.summary: Delete the file when the last handle to it is passed to NtClose. Requires Delete flag in DesiredAccess parameter.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_BY_FILE_ID
member.summary: Open the file by reference number or object ID. The file name that is specified by the ObjectAttributes name parameter includes the 8 or 16 byte file reference number or ID for the file in the ObjectAttributes name field. The device name can optionally be prefixed.
member.remarks: NTFS supports both reference numbers and object IDs. 16 byte reference numbers are 8 byte numbers padded with zeros. ReFS only supports reference numbers (not object IDs). 8 byte and 16 byte reference numbers are not related. Note that as the UNICODE_STRING will contain raw byte data, it may not be a "valid" string. Not used by device and intermediate drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_FOR_BACKUP_INTENT
member.summary: The file is being opened for backup intent. Therefore, the system should check for certain access rights and grant the caller the appropriate access to the file before checking the DesiredAccess parameter against the file's security descriptor.
member.remarks: Not used by device and intermediate drivers.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: When creating a file, specifies that it should not inherit the compression bit from the parent directory.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_REQUIRING_OPLOCK
member.summary: The file is being opened and an opportunistic lock (oplock) on the file is being requested as a single atomic operation.
member.remarks: The file system checks for oplocks before it performs the create operation and will fail the create with a return code of STATUS_CANNOT_BREAK_OPLOCK if the result would be to break an existing oplock. Not compatible with CompleteIfOplocked or ReserveOpFilter. Windows 7 and up.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_DISALLOW_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: CreateFile2 uses this flag to prevent opening a file that you don't have access to without specifying FILE_SHARE_READ. (Preventing users that can only read a file from denying access to other readers.)
member.remarks: Windows 7 and up.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_SESSION_AWARE
member.summary: The client opening the file or device is session aware and per session access is validated if necessary.
member.remarks: Windows 8 and up.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_RESERVE_OPFILTER
member.summary: This flag allows an application to request a filter opportunistic lock (oplock) to prevent other applications from getting share violations.
member.remarks: Not compatible with CompleteIfOplocked or OpenRequiringOplock. If there are already open handles, the create request will fail with STATUS_OPLOCK_NOT_GRANTED.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_REPARSE_POINT
member.summary: Open a file with a reparse point attribute, bypassing the normal reparse point processing.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_NO_RECALL
member.summary: Causes files that are marked with the Offline attribute not to be recalled from remote storage.
member.remarks: More details can be found in Remote Storage documentation (see Basic Concepts). https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc938459.aspx

member.name: T:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess
member.summary: System.IO.FileAccess looks up these values when creating handles
member.remarks: File Security and Access Rights https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa364399.aspx

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_READ_DATA
member.summary: For a file, the right to read data from the file.
member.remarks: Directory version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY
member.summary: For a directory, the right to list the contents.
member.remarks: File version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_WRITE_DATA
member.summary: For a file, the right to write data to the file.
member.remarks: Directory version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_ADD_FILE
member.summary: For a directory, the right to create a file in a directory.
member.remarks: File version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_APPEND_DATA
member.summary: For a file, the right to append data to a file. is needed to overwrite existing data.
member.remarks: Directory version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_ADD_SUBDIRECTORY
member.summary: For a directory, the right to create a subdirectory.
member.remarks: File version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_CREATE_PIPE_INSTANCE
member.summary: For a named pipe, the right to create a pipe instance.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_READ_EA
member.summary: The right to read extended attributes.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_WRITE_EA
member.summary: The right to write extended attributes.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_EXECUTE
member.summary: The right to execute the file.
member.remarks: Directory version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_TRAVERSE
member.summary: For a directory, the right to traverse the directory.
member.remarks: File version of this flag is .

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_DELETE_CHILD
member.summary: For a directory, the right to delete a directory and all the files it contains, including read-only files.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_READ_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The right to read attributes.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_WRITE_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The right to write attributes.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_ALL_ACCESS
member.summary: All standard and specific rights. [FILE_ALL_ACCESS]

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.DELETE
member.summary: The right to delete the object.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.READ_CONTROL
member.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor. Doesn't include system access control list info (SACL).

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.WRITE_DAC
member.summary: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.WRITE_OWNER
member.summary: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.SYNCHRONIZE
member.summary: The right to use the object for synchronization. Enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state. This is required if opening a synchronous handle.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.STANDARD_RIGHTS_READ
member.summary: Same as READ_CONTROL.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE
member.summary: Same as READ_CONTROL.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.STANDARD_RIGHTS_EXECUTE
member.summary: Same as READ_CONTROL.

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_GENERIC_READ
member.summary: Maps internally to | | | | . (For directories, | | | | .)

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_GENERIC_WRITE
member.summary: Maps internally to | | | | | . (For directories, | | AddFile | | | .)

member.name: F:Interop.NtDll.DesiredAccess.FILE_GENERIC_EXECUTE
member.summary: Maps internally to | | | . (For directories, | | | .)
